title: Canada Shuts Out Czechia 5 0 in Olympic Hockey Opener
snippets: Macklin Celebrini scored Canada's first goal in the return of NHL players to the Olympics and Jordan Binnington stopped all 26 shots he faced in a 5-0 defeat of Czechia.

Macklin Celebrini opened the scoring and Jordan Binnington made 26 saves for the shutout as Canada's NHL stars opened their quest for gold at the Milan Cortina Olympics with a 5-0 victory over Czechia on Thursday.
Connor McDavid registered three assists to help Canada shut out Czechia 5-0 on Thursday in an opening match of the Winter Olympics hockey tournament.

Team Canada sure looked like its dominant self for its first game of the Winter Olympics in Milan. Playing with NHLers for the first time since 2014, the gold-medal-favourite Canadians topped Czechia 5-0 in their preliminary-round opener on Thursday. Macklin Celebrini , the youngest player competing in this tournament, opened the scoring late in the first period, deflecting a point shot from Cale Makar. It stood as the game-winning goal. Mark Stone and Bo Horvat added goals in the second, while Nathan MacKinnon netted a power-play beauty with assists to Connor McDavid and Sidney Crosby....
After a 12-year absence of NHL players, the best-on-best event is back at the Olympics. Ahead of Thursday’s opener against Czechia, Rory Boylen has five storylines to keep in mind.

summary: Canada's men's hockey team defeated Czechia 5-0 in their opening game at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, marking the return of NHL players to the tournament after 12 years. Macklin Celebrini scored the first goal, and Jordan Binnington made 26 saves for the shutout. Connor McDavid contributed three assists.

title: EPA Revokes Endangerment Finding
snippets: The White House calls it the largest deregulation in US history, but environmentalists say it will prove costly for Americans.
EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin officially revoked the endangerment finding, in a huge blow to U.S. efforts to fight climate change.
The Trump administration on Thursday revoked a scientific finding that long has been the central basis for U.S. action to regulate greenhouse gas emissions.
